intro: Pauridiantha smetsiana, commonly known as the Smets' pauridiantha, is a flowering plant species native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, palmate leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within the rainforest understory. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
